results.title: Man of Aran [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Organisation Film Productions, GB Film Library and Robert Joseph Flaherty
results.brief_description: Extract from the Gaumont British production. The Man of Aran is seen with his two companions…Mikeleen is awakened by the sounds of the rising storm. Mideleen and his mother watch the flimsy craft battling for the shore. The men leap to safety but the sea drags the curragh boat back and smashes it. Man of Aran and his family return homewards.

results.title: Man of Aran
results.creator_credit: Robert Joseph Flaherty and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert Flaherty’s story of life on the sea stormed Isles of Aran, off the West Coast of Ireland. Produced in the early days of sound film, Flaherty tells his story simply and with great eloquence. His camera shows the daily events of life on the Isles - a profound and stirring drama of struggle against the elements. This struggle is caught and fixed again and again in images of women and boys against bleak land, vast threatening rocks or cloud-tossed sky, or of the fishermen’s boats lost to sight among heaving mountains of waves. Cinematography by Robert Flaherty.

results.title: Man looks at the moon
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and David MacDougall
results.brief_description: A study of the geology of the moon as surveyed by the naked eye, Galileo’s telescope, the largest telescopes, photography, spacecraft taking television pictures and finally, man actually on the moon collecting samples. Actual film shot on the moon is used extensively throughout. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Man is to man
results.creator_credit: United Nations, Television Suisse, Radio Tunis and Stanley Wright
results.brief_description: Describes the relief operation carried out jointly by trhe United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the League of Red Cross Societies on behalf of 200,000 Algerian refugees in Morocco and Tunisia. It is dedicated to all those who through their support made possible this humanitarian action. Commentary by Yul Brynner.

results.title: Man is a universe
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman
results.brief_description: This film reveals, in layman’s language, something of the progress made at the Montreal Neurological Institute in unravelling the mysteries of the human brain and nervous system. It shows some of the highly complex equipment used in neurological research and diagnosis, and follows a brain operation performed on an epileptic. Man’s brain and nervous system are, we see, a vast, unexplored universe about which much remains to be discovered.

results.title: Man is a builder
results.brief_description: Illustrates the important place held by the building industry in modern Britain, and the increasing demands being made for its service. Describes the men at craft, supervisory and executive levels, who are fulfilling the demands. Shows the training and skills they need, and some of the machines and methods they use.

results.title: Man in the white suit
results.creator_credit: Sir Michael Balcon, Alexander Mackendrick and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A scientist, played by Alec Guinnes, invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out. Unions and management are equally perturbed by this and endeavour to prevent its manufacture. Academy Award nomination for scripting.

results.title: Man in the peace tower
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, ONF | NFB and Roger Blais
results.brief_description: Robert Donnell is featured in his role of Dominion carilloneur at the Peace Tower in Ottawa. Interior views of the belfry with its bells, which range in weight from ten pounds to eleven tons, are shown.

results.title: Man in the Making
results.creator_credit: James McCloy, Brenda Horsfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Dr. J.M. Tanner, Reader in Growth and development in children at London University introduces this scientific study of the growth of the mind and body.”Man in the making” series probes the development of the child during the first few years of life.
